channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Trump clashes with Asian American reporter and ends press conference after dispute with CNN
item.description: President Donald Trump berated an Asian American reporter and then cut off his press conference after a CNN reporter he previously clashed with tried to question him.

item.title: PICTURED: Baby girl is believed to be the first US child with coronavirus and Kawasaki disease
item.description: Baby Zara, six months, who was diagnosed on March 16 with coronavirus, is believed to be the first documented case of a child in the US with both the virus and Kawasaki disease.

item.title: Fears of widespread burns and injuries as giant hogweed plants that can SCAR spread across Britain
item.description: The poisonous giant hogweed, 'Britain's most dangerous plant' that can cause severe burns or even blindness when touched, has returned with a vengeance due to this year's warm weather.

item.title: Ministers 'plan to pay up to 60 per cent of wages until SEPTEMBER' to some workers
item.description: The Treasury is known to be looking at ways to cut back the scheme, with the maximum grant of £2,500 per month likely to be lowered and the threshold for self-employed workers toughened from July.

item.title: Police constable, 41, is charged with murder after a woman died
item.description: Dorset Police constable Timothy Brehmer, 41, has been charged with murder following the death of a woman who was found injured at a car park in West Parley, the force said.

item.title: Children face being sent to DIFFERENT schools with staggered start times
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said that years one and six would be the first pupils to return to schools in England under his road map to ease the UK out of the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... easing the lockdown
item.description: 'There were only two passengers allowed on the train, Poirot - this should be a doddle'

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson reveals full lockdown exit plan
item.description: As people tried to make sense of the new rules, Boris Johnson was challenged at a No10 briefing this evening over what people should do if they bumped into friends or relatives at the park.

item.title: RIBA chief accused of abusing his position 'by helping his architect girlfriend to find a job'
item.description: Royal Institute of British Architects President Alan Jones, 55, is accused of helping Sanoara Begom get a job. Earlier this year, he emailed members to say he couldn't carry on with his duties.

item.title: Web giant unveils technology that can read even the most unintelligible scrawl
item.description: Users of app Google Lens simply need to scan a page of handwriting to turn it into digital text. This can then be pasted into a document to complete the transition.

item.title: Joe Wicks trademarks his name as he prepares to create his own 'food and cookery line'
item.description: The star, 33, has reportedly trademarked his name as he prepares to launch new food range that will include a variety of products from popcorn to babyfood.

item.title: Vera Wang, 70, stuns social media with her ageless looks
item.description: The fashion designer has been posting regular images of herself posing in different high-fashion looks while in lockdown at her home in Miami.

item.title: Foal does downward dog to reach grass
item.description: The yoga guru found that her legs were too long for her head to touch the ground at her family-owned farm in the Netherlands and discovered that a downward dog helped her.

item.title: So how many patients have died after catching coronavirus in hospital?
item.description: As the nation continues to control the spread of the coronavirus pandemic, grieving families are now asking if the deaths of their loved ones could have been avoided.

item.title: Delayed start to UK lockdown cost lives says expert
item.description: Professor Sir Lawrence Freedman said the Government followed public opinion rather than shaped it in the early days of the outbreak, before announcing the lockdown restrictions on March 23.

item.title: Does taking medication encourage an unhealthy lifestyle?
item.description: Research has found that many people are using their pills to continue bad habits rather than improve their diet or increase their exercise levels.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Inspiring courage and dedication from Covid medics - and patients
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: One of the strangest and most unsettling sensations of lockdown is caused by the telly time lag.

item.title: Donald Trump makes claim that tape of killing of Ahmaud Arbery might not be complete
item.description: President Donald Trump on Monday pointed to a brief moment in the videotaped killing of Ahmaud Arbery, saying 'nobody saw what was going on.'

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Looking a little tatty round the edges... No, not Boris Johnson, but his plan:
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Boris Johnson was hosting the Downing Street Press conference, where he faced a barrage of questions from journalists and the public on his plans to ease the lockdown.

item.title: British tourists could holiday in Greece without restrictions from June 1, says Greek government
item.description: British tourists could holiday again in Greece from June 1, according to the Greek government. Last year, four million Britons travelled to either mainland Greece or its islands.

item.title: Face to face with a killer: Part Two of JEFFREY ARCHER's short story Never Stop On The Motorway
item.description: JEFFREY ARCHER: Daniel raised the shotgun to his shoulder and stared straight at him. 'Don't move or I'll shoot,' he said calmly.

item.title: Dr MARTIN SCURR answers your health questions
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: Most people who take calcium supplements do so because they have osteoporosis, which weakens bones, making them more fragile and more likely to break.

item.title: Noel Gallagher reveals he suffered 'brutal panic attacks' while taking cocaine every night
item.description: The Oasis songwriter, 52, opened up about his struggles with the Class A substance and how he ended up in hospital in America after taking it.

item.title: Nearly EVERYONE who recovers from coronavirus develops antibodies to it, study finds
item.description: A study of 285 coronavirus patients in China found that 95% of them developed shorter term coronavirus antibodies within two weeks, and they all had longer term immunity within three.

item.title: Baby whose mother died from coronavirus just six days after his birth has been allowed home
item.description: New mother Fozia Hanif, 29, passed away in Birmingham Heartlands Hospital on April 8, without ever holding her son. Now baby Ayaan Hanif Ali has been allowed home with family.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Prince William and Kate Middleton honour medics
item.description: Prince William, 37, and Kate Middleton, 38, have shared a tribute to the nurses who have lost their lives to coronavirus while in service on the Kensington Palace Twitter account.

item.title: How an NHS trial is using virtual reality to tackle patients' worst phobias
item.description: Following a new approach of virtual reality therapy, which was run as part of a trial by Oxford University in 2018, the NHS is now looking to use the treatment to help those suffering from phobias.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 140k in England infected, swab tests suggest
item.description: Swab samples taken from thousands of people across England suggest 0.24% of the population is currently infected, equating to approximately 136,000 people.

item.title: 'I'm back!': Mike Tyson appears to CONFIRM a stunning return to boxing
item.description: The 53-year-old has left his swathes of fans excited over a possible return to the ring fifteen years after he hung up his gloves in 2005, having released a number of clips of himself working the pads.

item.title: Italian aid hostage home after being held by African extremists
item.description: Silvia Romano, a 24-year-old Italian woman held hostage in Africa for 18 months, was returned home on Sunday. She was abducted in November 2018 during an attack by gunmen in Kenya

item.title: Manchester United goalkeeper Sergio Romero 'ordered to tear down 'theme park'
item.description: The Manchester United and Argentina goalkeeper installed the play area for his two daughters alongside wife Eliana, having failed to obtain planning permission to do so.

item.title: Monty Don reveals his beloved pet dog Nigel has died after 'suddenly falling ill'
item.description: The television personality, 64, paid tribute to his 'old friend' via his Twitter and Instagram accounts on Monday, telling his followers Nigel was 'happy, healthy and his usual calm, lovely self'..

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE: Boris Johnson's Cabinet of loyalists risks sliding into a Covid civil war
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: According to one who was privy to the meeting, the PM had also singled out Mr Hancock for praise at Thursday's Cabinet meeting.

item.title: Park-goer who 'accosted Boris Johnson over a Costa' in St James' Park is millionaire company boss
item.description: EXCLUSIVE Boris Johnson was strolling through St James's Park in glorious sunshine swigging from a reusable coffee cup, when he was spotted by senior management advisor Bob Meadows.

item.title: Children are paying the price for this idiocy by a teachers' union, writes JOANNA WILLIAMS
item.description: JOANNA WILLIAMS: After weeks of sniping at the Government's approach to shutting Britain's schools, one might have expected the National Education Union to offer up a message of support.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Musicals maestro Sir Tim Rice sounds off at Oscars sermons
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Tim Rice has no need to sing for his supper, which might explain why the forthright lyricist has just lashed out at Hollywood's Academy Awards.

item.title: Two thirds of people who test positive for coronavirus lost their sense of smell
item.description: Researchers from Harvard University and King's College London tracked the symptoms of 2.6 million app users. Loss of smell was the symptom most predictive of a positive test, they found.

item.title: Coronation Street's 60th anniversary will be marked by the release of Weatherfield-inspired stamps
item.description: To soap fans it has always been the show that delivers. Now Coronation Street is to appear on a set of Royal Mail stamps. Best-loved double acts will be featured to mark the Street's 60th anniversary.

item.title: Joy as 52 migrants are saved from languishing in Greek camps and flown to the UK to start afresh
item.description: Waving goodbye to a hellish life in Greek camps, dreams of a better life in Britain became a reality for a group of vulnerable migrants yesterday, thanks to a Mail exposé which highlighted their struggles.

item.title: Gladiator's savage off screen battles: TOM LEONARD examines what went on behind the scenes
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Never was a movie hero better named. Gladiator - the epic Ridley Scott film starring Russell Crowe that is 20 years old this week - was 'maximus' in every way.

item.title: Men working in the lowest-skilled jobs face the highest risk of dying from the coronavirus
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics shows a sliding scale of death risk in England and Wales which gives lower paid workers considerably higher chances of dying of COVID-19.

item.title: Donald Trump is asked exactly what 'Obamagate crime' Barack Obama committed
item.description: Trump had spent almost 36 hours morning unleashing a series of tweets mentioning 'Obamagate' but offered no clarity on what he meant by it at a White House press conference.

item.title: Families face VERY delicate decision on which of their relatives to invite into their social bubble
item.description: From Wednesday onward Britons are permitted to meet with one person from outside their household in an outdoor setting, as long as they maintain social distancing - but who will you pick?

item.title: Hares were almost TAMED 5,000 years ago
item.description: Scientists claim the long-eared animal likely developed a close relationship with people living in a remote part of China on the Loess Plateau.

item.title: Seinfeld Jason Alexander pays tribute to Jerry Stiller who played his father on the hit show
item.description: Seinfeld's Jason Alexander has joined the outpouring of the tributes for the late actor Jerry Stiller, who has died at the age of 92 from natural causes.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government's workplace guidance after lockdown
item.description: The Government unveiled workplace guidance for eight different sectors of the economy today as Boris Johnson took the first baby steps towards restarting the economy.

item.title: Los Angeles inmates infect themselves with coronavirus in bid to win early release
item.description: LA County Sheriff Alex Villanueva announced Monday that 21 inmates at a Castaic jail intentionally infected each other with COVID-19 in a bid to win early release.

item.title: Elon Musk defies coronavirus lockdown and reopens Tesla plant
item.description: Employees were seen reporting to the Tesla facility in Fremont before sunrise on Monday - two days after the automaker sued local authorities over the facility's closure.

item.title: MORE international travel anarchy as Boris's roadmap
item.description: France and Ireland are on the 'shortlist' but it is not known if other of the most popular destinations for millions of Britons each year such as the Spain, Germany and the United States will join them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Keir Starmer says return to normal life impossible
item.description: The Labour party leader said returning to pre-March life would be 'impossible' after 'all this sacrifice and all this loss'. Boris Johnson has been widely criticised for his message to the public on Sunday.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Over 27M watched Boris Johnson speech
item.description: Boris Johnson's speech outlining his coronavirus lockdown exit plan attracted more than 27million viewers in Britain, making it the eighth most-watched TV event in British history.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle put screens up at $18m mansion
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have erected screens around the Beverly Hills area mansion where they are living, after it was discovered people could see directly onto the grounds.

item.title: What you REALLY need in your family first aid kit
item.description: First aid kits can vary in price enormously, but according to a report from the Consumers' Association many off-the-shelf first aid kits contain items that most people will have little use for.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Pubs and cinemas could reopen from 4 July
item.description: Hospitality businesses could reopen starting from July 4 if they meet 'Covid secure guidelines'. The Government is yet to publish guidance on how workplaces can become 'Covid secure'.

item.title: Will doctor's appointment with Jeremy Clarkson win him £1m?
item.description: Andrew Townsley, 53, from Glasgow, makes it to the final stage of the ITV quiz show in Tuesday night's episode. He said he would spend the prize money on a trip to see Niagara Falls, Canada.

item.title: Humpback whale appears in front of family fishing trip in Alaska
item.description: A humpback whale showed off by breaching the waters off Alaska's Kachemak Bay and was spotted by a Tess Abbott, her children and a friend who were together on a fishing trip at the time.

item.title: Back To The Future reunion! Michael J. Fox recites lines with Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson
item.description: Superfan Josh Gad orchestrated the reunion on the latest episode of his YouTube series, Reunited Apart, where he also brought on writer Bob Gale and director Robert Zemeckis.

item.title: Prince Harry spoke with the families of WWII survivors on BBC's The One Show tonight.
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, appeared on BBC's The One Show tonight. The Duke of Sussex spoke to the families of WWII survivors who suffered horrific burns in battle.

item.title: Boris Johnson issues grim warning that scientists may NEVER find a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: The Prime Minister said we may be living with the disease for a long time - despite the UK being at the forefront of efforts to defeat it.

item.title: Skeletons of two 'warrior women' whose lived 1,500 years ago may have inspired the story of Mulan
item.description: Archaeologists uncovered skeletons of two 'warrior women' who were skilled archers and road horseback in Mongolia 1,500 years ago that may have inspired the story of Mulan.

item.title: The agony and the ecstasy of first love
item.description: What is it about hit BBC drama Normal People that has struck such a chord? The beautiful Ireland scenery? The smooth-skinned beauty of its two characters, Connell and Marianne?

item.title: NHS nurse with UK's first case of covid-related laryngitis gives rallying speech as she's discharged
item.description: NHS nurse Nancy who was diagnosed with the UK's first case of covid-related laryngitis gave a rallying speech as she was discharged from Royal Free London on BBC2's Hospital: Fighting Covid-19

item.title: New move to send patients to care home sparks fury as relatives of residents threaten to sue council
item.description: Relatives of elderly care home residents are threatening legal action against a council over plans to admit recovering Covid-19 patients into the property, which has so far been virus-free.

item.title: Different UK areas could have different lockdown rules
item.description: The Government's road map suggests that parts of the UK, regions in England and even individual schools could have 'localised lockdowns' if they have outbreaks.

item.title: Tui's 10-point post-lockdown holiday plan reduces buffets
item.description: Tui, the UK's biggest tour operator, says the new standards will be implemented at its Tui Blu, Robinson and Tui Magic Life resorts as well as its joint venture and partner hotels.

item.title: Do I REALLY have to wash my shopping when it's delivered?
item.description: As the nation continues to control the spread of Covid-19, we look at the range of questions readers have asked in regards to the pandemic.

item.title: Is inflammation the link between dementia, cancer and coronavirus?
item.description: Inflammation lies at the root of health conditions such as type 2 diabetes, heart disease, Alzheimer's, cancer and Covid-19 and could be a clue to what lies behind the high number of UK coronavirus deaths.

item.title: Red-faced MP turns the air blue as she says 'oh f****** hell' to the Commons
item.description: Conservative MP for South Derbyshire Heather Wheeler was speaking during a debate on Covid-19 when an apparent fault with her feed emerged.

item.title: The doctor, 30, who feared she would die with coronavirus
item.description: Dr Geraldine McGroarty, who works as a locum doctor in A&E, was admitted to the Royal Free Hospital in London last month after contracting Covid-19.

item.title: New study reveals how Chinook salmon use the Earth's magnetic pulses to help navigate in the ocean
item.description: Scientists have long been puzzled by how Chinook salmon navigate from the Pacific Ocean around Alaska and Canada to freshwater rivers and streams to lay eggs during mating season.

item.title: Woman left with rotting boobs after botched breast reduction
item.description: Esmeralda describes how she was left with a 'hole' in each of her breasts in a preview clip for Monday night's episode of the E! reality series Botched.

item.title: Jeremy Paxman celebrates his 70th birthday in casual clothes to walk his dog
item.description: He's known for his sharp suits and even sharper mind as he grills students on hit TV quiz show University Challenge, but the former Newsnight host sported a beard and shorts while walking his dog.

item.title: The joy of raising a wild child! PATRICK BARKHAM tells about an unorthodox outdoor nursery
item.description: PATRICK BARKHAM: Even when it rains at Dandelion Education, which is completely off-grid, they are as dismissive of drizzle as ducklings.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Our briefly united kingdom is already being torn apart
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: The basic message was, apparently, too complicated for our puny minds. The Scots didn't like it. Neither did the Welsh, or the Northern Irish.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Mike Pence aide joked about testing positive
item.description: Katie Miller, the aide to Vice President Mike Pence who tested positive for the coronavirus on Friday, coughed during a nursing home visit the day before and joked to reporters she didn't have it.

item.title: Microsoft feature could end embarrassing 'Reply All' emails
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out 'Reply-All Storm Protection' to Office 365 and Exchange Online that prevents users from responding to all the recipients in a single thread.

item.title: Man spends 35 years and £50k restoring limousine Queen rode in
item.description: A classic car enthusiast, from Sutton Coldfield, is back on the road in a 1939 French limousine which is believed to have chauffeured the Queen after a tireless 35-YEAR restoration project.

item.title: Venezuela exposed US 'mercenaries' plan weeks before coup fail
item.description: On March 28, an episode of President Maduro's weekly low-budget propaganda show publicly exposed the American 'mercenaries'' plan on live TV.

item.title: Interpol issues international arrest warrant for Harry Dunn's alleged killer Anne Sacoolas
item.description: Anne Sacoolas, 42, is charged in the UK with causing the death 19-year-old Harry Dunn by dangerous driving following a crash in Northamptonshire in August last year.

item.title: Coronavirus Europe: George Soros says it could end the EU
item.description: Soros expressed his doubts about the institution's survival as it is an 'incomplete union' and cited Germany's ruling on the European Central Bank as a cause for concern.

item.title: Lifetime announces plans to make a Prince Harry and Meghan Markle movie about Megxit
item.description: Tentatively titled Harry & Meghan: Escaping the Palace, the fictional account will cover the events surrounding their decision to step down as senior royals.

item.title: Nicky Campbell's wife stops men stealing catalytic converter
item.description: Tina stormed down the garden path to confront the two robbers at their home in Greater Manchester. Two men had used a vehicle jack to raise the family car in the middle of the street.

item.title: James Middleton surprises fiancée by shaving off his beard
item.description: James Middleton, 32, has taken to Instagram to share a video of himself shaving his beard off for the first time in seven years - before surprising his fiancée Alizee Thevenet.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: NHS England reveals which hospitals worst hit
item.description: Data from NHS England shows that every major hospital in the country has recorded at least one COVID-19 victim and the worst affected are in London, Birmingham, Manchester and Derby.

item.title: Coronavirus Canada: Cannibal killer porn star could be released
item.description: Canadian cannibal porn star Luka Magnotta was arrested in 2012 for killing his lover Jun Lin, and was found guilty of his death, as well as killing cats in 2014.

item.title: Police launch hunt for missing British diplomat, 52, who vanished after going for a run
item.description: Richard Morris has held a number of high profile positions in the Foreign and Commonwealth Office. He was due to begin a new role as British High Commissioner to Republic of Fiji in July.

item.title: Roy Horn woke from coma to 'wave goodbye' to partner Siegfried
item.description: Roy woke briefly from a coma, wiggled his fingers, before taking his final breath Friday, DailyMail.com has learned.

item.title: Premier League clubs have discussed CURTAILING the season for the first time
item.description: Clubs continue to believe that the 2019-20 campaign can be finished despite nearly two months passing since it was first suspended after Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta contracted coronavirus.

item.title: First pictures of church warden, 88, who was stabbed to death in Co-op
item.description: John Rees, 88, was described by his family as the definition of a good man as the first pictures emerged since his tragic death at the convenience store in Pen-y-Graig, south Wales.

item.title: Billionaire jewellery tycoon Navi Modi fights extradition to India over £1.5billion bank fraud
item.description: Navi Modi, 49, owner of Firestar Diamond, is wanted by authorities in India for allegedly taking part in the country's biggest ever fraud on the state-run Punjab National Bank (PNB).

item.title: Diner in China watches a chef 'SPITTING' into dish he's cooking
item.description: The customer in China was watching surveillance footage of a restaurant he had complained about when he made the shocking discovery. The restaurant has been shut amid an investigation.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: British expats in Benidorm have pub pints
item.description: Bars and cafes in the famous Costa Blanca resort started getting back to business this morning as coronavirus restrictions in large swathes of Spain including Benidorm eased.

item.title: Pregnant women are NOT at greater risk of being hospitalised with severe COVID-19
item.description: Some 427 mothers-to-be were admitted to NHS hospitals with the coronavirus between March 1 and April 14. But only one in ten needed treatment in ICU.

item.title: Maltese ambassador resigns after comparing Angela Merkel to Hitler
item.description: Malta's ambassador to Finland Michael Zammit Tabona has resigned after writing a Facebook post comparing Angela Merkel to Adolf Hitler and saying her aim was 'to control Europe.'

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 32,065 with 210 new fatalities
item.description: The daily death toll is the smallest in six-and-a-half weeks (183 on March 26), fuelling hope that the worst days of the first wave of the UK's crisis have been and gone.

item.title: Tycoon blackmailed over sex videos involving transgender son
item.description: Westminster Magistrates' Court was told the father was 'a businessman of public standing' while his son was 'somebody who struggles with their gender identity and sexuality'.

item.title: The world's smallest prison? The tiny jail on the Channel Island of Sark with just TWO CELLS
item.description: Sark is a tiny island measuring just 2.1 square miles, with a tiny population, 500 or so, and, as these pictures show - it has a tiny prison to match.

item.title: The new advice to avoid catching coronavirus
item.description: The guidelines, part of the government's 50-page exit plan, have also advised people to continue washing their hands, work from home if possible and to wear face masks on public transport.

item.title: Africa's golden hour: Stunning images of the savannah at sunset
item.description: The stunning photographs show heavenly rays of warm sunshine resting over the vast expanse of the African savanna, mixing with the dust and foliage to create a misty haze.

item.title: Girlfriend makes idiot-proof shopping list for her boyfriend
item.description: TikTok user Steff, from Canada, explained she gave her boyfriend, who was not named, as much detail as possible in order to avoid him phoning her from the store with a list of questions.

item.title: UK swallow and swift sightings fall after a freak storm in April
item.description: In April thousands of birds migrating from Africa to Europe died due to high winds battering Greece at the time - they found lying in the streets of Athens.

item.title: Paul Burrell shares unseen note Princess Diana wrote to him
item.description: Princess Diana's former butler has shared an unseen letter from the late royal, in which she reveals that a visit to Mother Teresa's Calcutta home in 1992 left her 'soaring to new spiritual heights.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Tourism boards urge people to stay at home
item.description: Both Cornwall and Cumbria's tourism board have urged people not to travel to their beauty spots and the 'stay home' message has not changed in Wales and Scotland, ministers have stated.

item.title: Three cannabis growers are jailed after £820,000 drugs farm the size of a FOOTBALL PITCH was found
item.description: Three cannabis growers have been jailed after their football pitch-sized farm worth £820,000 was uncovered by a police officer who smelt it on while on patrol in Gateshead, Newcastle.

item.title: Ian Wright reveals the sickening abuse directed at him on Instagram
item.description: The 56-year-old, who also played for Crystal Palace and West Ham during his 15-year professional career, took to Twitter to share three screenshots of sick messages sent to him online.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government considering expanding contact groups and small weddings may be allowed
item.description: The Government is considering allowing people to mix in 'bubbles', expanding to one other household group, new guidance says. Small weddings may also be allowed to take place.

item.title: 'Evil' church warden, 29, who murdered university lecturer, 69, appeals conviction
item.description: Benjamin Field was jailed for at least 36 years for killing Peter Farquhar from Buckinghamshire. Field pleaded guilty to defrauding Mr Farquhar but denied any involvement in his death.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Vaccine may not be found, warns Boris Johnson
item.description: In his 50-page roadmap for the nation to ease its way out of lockdown he said the only long-term hope to get back to something resembling normality was a medical breakthrough.

item.title: Europe's earliest humans wore bear-teeth 'beads' 45k years ago
item.description: The landmark finding comes from analysis of human remains found at a cave known as Bacho Kiro located in Bulgaria and proves Europeans overlapped for millennia with Neanderthals.

item.title: Coronavirus Belgium: Prince Laurent says Princess Claire ill
item.description: Prince Laurent of Belgium, 56, has revealed how his family were 'hit' when British-born Princess Claire, 46, became 'seriously ill' six months ago, according to Royal Central.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Wear face masks in public, new guidance says
item.description: Official UK Government advice released this afternoon said face coverings will help people avoid transmitting the disease to others if they have it without any symptoms.

item.title: Leather products are covered in MOULD after they were left untouched in Malaysian store
item.description: The startling images of ruined products were taken in a Malaysian shopping centre as the country prepares to enter its third month of coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: BBC reporter Sima Kotecha cancels live broadcast in Leicester after being subjected to racist abuse
item.description: BBC News reporter Sima Kotecha was in Leicester preparing a live reaction piece when she was racially abused by a man who shouted 'terrible things' at her and her production team.

item.title: Boris Johnson vows to get transport moving 'as quickly as possible'
item.description: The battle over the future of transport in the capital is playing out against a wider clash clash between the private sector and the government as it tries to get back to work .

item.title: Mischievous fox cub gets wedged between two brick walls for 24 hours
item.description: The female cub had fallen into a tiny gap between the wall of a house and garage in Worthing, West Sussex. But RSPCA inspector Andrew Kirby chipped off some of the mortar to wiggle her free.

item.title: Perfect for movie night! Tudor-style mansion goes up for sale for £8.25m
item.description: A Tudor-style Manor house in a celebrity hotspot with 'the best home cinema in the UK' has gone on sale for £8.25m. It is on the sought-after Nightingales Lane in Buckinghamshire.

item.title: Matt Lucas knows seven people who have died from coronavirus
item.description: Comedian Matt Lucas knows seven people to have died from Covid-19. The Little Britain writer revealed the heartbreaking total after a fan criticised him for mocking Boris Johnson in a video on Sunday.

item.title: Police hunt for missing girl, 16, as her phone signal is traced to a skate park near her home
item.description: Since detectives traced her phone signal to the skate park in Havant, Hampshire, Louise Smith's phone has been turned off and there have been no sightings of the 16-year-old.
item.media:credit: HNP Picture Desk/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd

item.title: 'Trikini' - a bikini with matching face mask - proves a hit in Italy
item.description: Tiziana Scaramuzzo, the owner of Elexa Beachwear in Senigallia, central Italy, began producing the pandemic-proof beachwear to lift the mood at home before naming it the Trikini.

item.title: Peru Two drug mule Michaella McCollum celebrates her twin sons' second birthday
item.description: Mother-of-two Michaella McCollum, of County Tyrone, Northern Ireland, posted adorable snaps of sons Rafael and Rio playing with balloons, books and bicycles at the family home.

item.title: David Cameron's wife Samantha shares photo of daughter Nancy and family's Oxfordshire home
item.description: Samantha Cameron snapped husband David building a flat-pack chicken coop with daughter Nancy, 16, in the garden of the family's Oxfordshire home.

item.title: Woman, 24, makes £10,000 a MONTH as a virtual assistant
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Jemma Broadstock, from Derbyshire, works as a virtual assistant (VA) helping charities and small business owners such as therapists andy salon owners with tasks.

item.title: Mother turned her home from 'the ugliest on the street' to a stunning modern three-story house
item.description: Joanne Lewis, from Kent, bought the seventies one-bedroom 'upside down' house by the sea in 2018, before setting about transforming it into a four-bedroom home.

item.title: Gang of thugs smash up woman's car and shatter windows of her home in savage broad daylight attack
item.description: The attack caught on CCTV in Ilford, east London on Friday saw the woman just make it inside before they arrived and began battering her door, smashing her car and house windows.

item.title: Royal Family reveals how you can create a miniature version of Queen Mary's Doll's House
item.description: The Royal Family has taken to Instagram to reveal how parents and homeschoolers can create a miniature version of Queen Mary's Doll's house which was finished in 1924.

item.title: Skateboarder, 11, becomes first ever to perform 1,080-degree turn
item.description: Gui Khury from Brazil shattered the long-standing record by flying off the top of a ramp and completing three full spins in the air before landing cleanly and skating off.

item.title: Prince Charles shares recipe for his 'favourite' brunch recipe Cheesy Eggs
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, who is currently isolating in his Aberdeenshire home of Birkhall, shared the step-by-step guide to 'one of his favourite recipes' on the @ClarenceHouse Instagram page.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon BANS Boris's Stay Alert slogan in Scotland as lockdown road map becomes shambles
item.description: The First Minister said she would ignore the Prime Minister's much-criticised new 'Stay Alert, Control the Virus, Save Lives' slogan in favour of the previous 'Stay Home' message.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson's exit strategy is in chaos
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab insisted the government is not urging workers to return until Wednesday, despite No10's official press release saying they should go back today.

item.title: Ofcom receives 241 complaints after Miriam Margolyes said she 'wanted Boris Johnson to die'
item.description: Ofcom has received 241 complaints after Miriam Margolyes said she had wanted Prime Minister Boris Johnson to die from coronavirus.

item.title: Paralysed former police dog Vinnie is given a new lease of life as he is fitted with a set of WHEELS
item.description: Vinnie, a seven-year-old German shepherd, served Dorset Police for five years before a spinal cord disease led to the paralysis of his hind legs. He has now been given a specialist dog wheelchair.

item.title: Sex workers reveal they've continued to meet clients despite the lockdown
item.description: Speaking anonymously to BBC reporter Jonathan Gibson, male and female sex workers told how they have travelled across the UK in recent weeks to visit clients at home and in their offices.

item.title: Prince Harry praises young Brits for 'surviving but also for thriving' in video message from LA home
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, shared a video message with those attending the virtual OnSide Awards from his home in Los Angeles, praising the British youngsters for 'thriving' during coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Researchers uncover MORE evidence that smokers may be protected from the deadly coronavirus
item.description: Fewer than five per cent of 441 COVID-19 patients admitted to an Italian hospital were smokers - a 'very low' number, given that a quarter of the general population are smokers.

item.title: Germany relaxes more coronavirus restrictions despite rate of infection spiking
item.description: Germany pushed ahead with relaxing more coronavirus lockdown measures on Monday as gyms, cafes and even pubs in the country's largest state were allowed to reopen.

item.title: NHS worker, 19, 'forced to scrub her face with bleach' after using the wrong shade of tan
item.description: Kelsey Chambers, 19, from Newcastle, used £13 St Moriz Darker Than Dark lotion when trying to cheer herself up in lockdown, and told The Sun she had to use diluted bleach to get it off.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Boris Johnson's shameful mixed messages will cost many more lives
item.description: By the end of Prime Minister Boris Johnson's meandering, often nonsensical address, people were more confused than they were before it, writes PIERS MORGAN.

item.title: Woman reveals cruelty she witnessed while working for a princess in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Catherine Coleman told The Times she took the Riyadh-based role because she was tempted by the higher pay after spending years running her own antiques business in the UK.

item.title: Number of TV licenses plunges by 82,000 in five months to lowest figure since 2015
item.description: In the five months to March the number of licenses in Britain dropped by 82,000 to the lowest figure since 2014-15, the BBC disclosed in a freedom of information request.

item.title: Men have high levels of enzyme key to COVID-19 infection, study finds
item.description: Men's blood has higher levels of a key enzyme used by the new coronavirus to infect cells, a new study reports, which may explain why they are more likely to die from COVID-19 than women.

item.title: Are YOU a victim of coercive control? Domestic abuse expert reveals red flags to watch out for
item.description: Dr Emma Katz, of Liverpool Hope University, told FEMAIL cases will escalate in the UK as perpetrators ramp up abuse to try to counteract the loss of control caused by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Student nurse, 21, creates mouthwatering cocktails
item.description: Georgia McAvoy, 21, from Lanarkshire, started making cocktails just two weeks ago after the warm weather made her crave her favourite Tenerife tipples during the lockdown.

item.title: Footage of a woman pleasuring herself on one of IKEA store's sofas goes viral
item.description: IKEA has said it will take 'more careful' security measures in its shops in China after an explicit video showed a woman performing a sex act in various sofas and beds in one branch.

item.title: Tricky trivia quiz will put your knowledge to the test
item.description: The latest quiz shared by American trivia site Playbuzz will put your general knowledge of everything from World Wars to classic novels to the test. So how many will you get right?
